title: SK Schwadorf
text:
Sportklub Schwadorf (more commonly known as SK Schwadorf) was an <a href="Austria">Austria</a>n <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> club, based in <a href="Schwadorf">Schwadorf</a>. They were last playing in the <a href="Austrian%20Football%20First%20League">First League</a>. The club was known as Trenkwalder Sportklub Schwadorf for sponsorship reasons — "Trenkwalder" being the company of chairman <a href="Richard%20Trenkwalder">Richard Trenkwalder</a>. In 2008, the club merged with <a href="VfB%20Admira%20Wacker%20M%C3%B6dling">VfB Admira Wacker Mödling</a> to become <a href="Trenkwalder%20Admira">Trenkwalder Admira</a>.
History.
The club was founded as ASK Schwadorf in May 1936, and played its first game on 7 June of that year, against <a href="Fischamend">Fischamend</a>, winning 4–3.
On 8 August 2005, ASK Schwadorf hosted Spanish club <a href="Real%20Madrid">Real Madrid</a> in a pre-season friendly. The visitors fielded a team that included former <a href="FIFA%20World%20Player%20of%20the%20Year">FIFA World Player of the Year</a>, <a href="Zinedine%20Zidane">Zinedine Zidane</a>, <a href="Ra%C3%BAl%20Gonz%C3%A1lez">Raúl</a>, <a href="David%20Beckham">David Beckham</a> and <a href="Michael%20Owen">Michael Owen</a>, <a href="Ronaldo%20%28Brazilian%20footballer%29">Ronaldo</a> and <a href="Roberto%20Carlos%20da%20Silva">Roberto Carlos</a>. Real won 4–1, with the goals coming from Raúl, Ronaldo, <a href="Javier%20Portillo%20%28Spanish%20footballer%29">Javier Portillo</a> and Owen.
Similarly, the club welcomed English Premier League side <a href="Arsenal%20F.C.">Arsenal</a> for a pre-season friendly on 31 July 2006. The visitors, whose line-up featured only a couple of familiar names, won 8–1.
The club won the <a href="Austrian%20Landesliga">Landesliga</a> championship in 2005–06 by a margin of twelve points.
They went on to win the <a href="Austrian%20Regional%20League%20East">Austrian Regional League East</a> in 2006–07, thus achieving promotion for the fifth time in six years. Of their 30 league games, they won 22, drew 6, and lost 2. They finished seven points ahead of second-placed <a href="Polizei%20Feuerwehr">Polizei Feuerwehr</a>.
Between 2005 and 2007, their manager was <a href="Attila%20Sekerlioglu">Attila Sekerlioglu</a>. Sekerlioglu was fired in August 2007, and replaced by <a href="Bernd%20Krauss">Bernd Krauss</a>.
Prior to the 2007–08 season, the club changed its name from ASK Schwadorf to SK Schwadorf. The following season, 2008–09, Richard Trenkwalder bought the team, relocated it to <a href="S%C3%BCdstadt">Südstadt</a>, and merged it with <a href="VfB%20Admira%20Wacker%20M%C3%B6dling">VfB Admira Wacker Mödling</a> to become <a href="Trenkwalder%20Admira">Trenkwalder Admira</a>. For the 2013–14 season they are playing in the <a href="Austrian%20Football%20Bundesliga">Austrian Football Bundesliga</a>.
Records.
The club's biggest victory took place on 22 April 1983, when they beat <a href="ASK%20Edelsthal">ASK Edelsthal</a> 10–0. Their reserve team, ASK Schwadorf II, won 19–0 on the same day.
